intro: Lobelia kinangopia, commonly known as the Kinangop lobelia, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Kenya. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and humid conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Lobelia kinangopia is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
